intro: Popowia caesia var. subacuta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved popowia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in subtropical gardens.
